contextId.occurrenceNote: The writer speaks to the walls of Jerusalem. He wants the people of Jerusalem to do what he is telling the walls to do. Some translations take this whole section to be spoken to the "walls," though this can be written with the first phrase "walls of the daughter of Zion!" spoken to the "walls," and the rest of the section spoken directly to the people. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-apostrophe]])
contextId.glQuote: walls of the daughter of Zion! Make your tears flow ... no relief

contextId.glQuote: Arise, cry out ... of every street
